descriptionHtml:
[size=6]Sky Factory[/size]

What it is:
[size=3]Sky Factory is my first attempt to bring some factory building mechanism to Skyrim. As you progress towards the end game, you will be washed with a lot of treasure. With so much redundant money, there should be more ways to spend them.

[/size]Sky Factory consists 2 NPCs who can be found in Breezehome in Whiterun. Skyrim Factory Vendor will sell you token for workshops such as Cattle Farm or Brewery. You then drop these tokens into Resource Manager. Resource Manager will cast a custom spell. Each cast measures 1 day of work done in each shop in her inventory. If you got required resource and workshop token, the resource will be converted to the product. These outputs can be further manufactured to a lot of useful product or sold for gold.

How does it work:
Resource Manager is actually a cleaned copy of Aela the Huntress. She casts a spell that runs a script. This script check each type of token, how many token she has and how much resource in her pocket can be used with the token. This then deletes the resource and add the resulting product. (All of this happens in the inventory of Aela the resource manager.)

There are 3 types of buildings.
1. resource building: like mines, farm. They need tools (token) to make resources.
2. factory: like ore refinery, alchemist. This type of building converts resources to usable stuff. An alchemist can convert herbs produced by herbalist into usable health potions.
3. shop: mostly inns and shops. They sell these usable products to earn gold.

You can also buy a few men and women. With houses, they can start a family. Family pay tax and give birth to children. Children will grow up and this repeating process can get a village started. Inns and shops can sell various products for gold depending on how many families there are in the village.

Spoiler:
It might be difficult to figure out what shop to build. I have attached my mindmap for the entire design.

When you talk to the resource manager, you can open up her inventory.
Drop the resources, tokens and anything else into her inventory. Then you need to make sure it is during day time. She should start to cast a green spell. This spell will run that script. All the magic should happen properly.

You should also reference to the mindmap to decide how to setup a production loop. That is part of the fun for this mod.

Future:
The current version does not have any custom model or building an actual farm. Everything happen on token level. I am definitely interested in placing token in some wilderness and build an entire custom town of your own. That is currently a long term goal. The structure yields a lot of gold and a lot of left overs of different types of useful items.
